question: What is the purpose of the Enron Wholesale Services (EWS) Chinese Wall policy?
golden_answer: The Chinese Wall policy serves to reduce the risk of insider trading liability by keeping material non-public information walled off from our equity trading personnel.

question: What role does the Resource Group play in Enron's Chinese Wall policy?
golden_answer: The Resource Group acts as a sort of filter so that certain information may pass through the "wall", under appropriate controls.

question: Who is organizing the training sessions on Chinese Wall policies and procedures?
golden_answer: The ENA Legal Department will conduct training sessions on Chinese Wall policies and procedures.

question: What is the proposed approach for legal staffing in the internet project mentioned in the email?
golden_answer: Using Clifford Chance as project manager is a good idea and will speed up the process, with the suggestion to use normal outside Continental counsel for both internet issues and trading/commodity issues.

question: Who is assisting another client with setting up an internet derivatives trading system?
golden_answer: Intuitive Products International based in New York and London is assisting with system design.

question: What changes were made to Section 19 of the Sofregaz Agreement?
golden_answer: The changes made were to Section 19, General Indemnity, in the proposed Capital Construction Term Rate Agreement with Sofregaz US.

question: What was the amount of Excess Umbrella Liability Insurance coverage changed to in the Sofregaz Agreement?
golden_answer: The Excess Umbrella Liability Insurance coverage was changed to a $10,000,000 amount.

question: Who approved the changes to the Sofregaz Agreement internally before sending them to Sofregaz?
golden_answer: EECC's legal department approved the changes, and Gerald Nemec and Enron Storage Co. were asked to review and approve them as well.

question: What was the final document sent to Sofregaz for execution regarding insurance coverage?
golden_answer: The final document sent for execution showed the $10,000,000 excess liability amount.

question: Why was Gerald Nemec interested in joining a group gift for Larry's wife's baby shower?
golden_answer: Gerald Nemec expressed interest in joining a group gift for the baby shower of Larry's wife, indicating he wanted to contribute.

question: What event was originally scheduled for September 4, 1998, at Enron?
golden_answer: Welcome Lunch @ 12

question: What are the two types of matter numbers mentioned in the email from Mike Day regarding legal budgeting?
golden_answer: Open matter numbers approved for some level of activity or expected additional activity, and matter numbers believed should be closed with no more costs or activity.

question: What was the purpose of the PG&E press release mentioned in the email forwarded by Mona Petrochko?
golden_answer: It was related to PG&E's Hydro Auction Application for auctioning their hydro facilities/assets.

question: Who was the IEP Policy Director mentioned in the email discussing PG&E's Hydro Auction Application?
golden_answer: Steven Kelly

question: Which organizations jointly submitted comments in Docket No. 98-REN-CCS according to the email from Rick Counihan?
golden_answer: ABAG Energy, Commonwealth Energy, Dynegy, Enron Corp., GreenMountain.com, New Energy, Inc., PacifiCorp, PG&E Energy Services, and Utility.com

question: What potential crisis did Joe Hartsoe refer to in his email regarding the Commission's Order on California?
golden_answer: Joe Hartsoe referred to a 'Constitutional Crisis' in his email regarding the Commission's Order on California.

question: What was the purpose of the first draft attached in the email from Elizabeth Sager regarding NERC's response to TVA?
golden_answer: The purpose of the first draft was to set the record straight while being careful not to scare NERC away.

question: According to Christi Nicolay's email, what specific questions did Dan Watkiss's revised memo address regarding FERC's authority?
golden_answer: The memo specifically answered questions about FERC's authority to fix the sink, net scheduling, and interconnection issues.

question: What documents were attached in Sherri Reinartz's email forwarding the ELCON Memorandum?
golden_answer: The attached documents included a Memorandum on NERC Letters to Congress, Summary Comments of John Anderson, a Memorandum on Proposals for Regional Advisory Bodies and Savings Clauses, a Document concerning the NARUC Savings Clause Language, and a Letter to The Honorable Joe Barton.

question: What tool did Christi Nicolay recommend using to view the revisions in the SERC/TVA Agreement email?
golden_answer: She recommended using LAUNCH to see the redlines (TVA) and bluelines (Enron).

question: According to Christi Nicolay's email about SERC/TVA/Enron, what was the status of the agreement between TVA and Enron as of the latest round of language?
golden_answer: As of the latest round of language, TVA and Enron were still working on the wording and may not have reached an agreement.

question: What was the issue with the approval of trades involving counterparties on the Credit Watch List?
golden_answer: The issue was that traders were informed they would be fired if they executed a transaction with a counterparty on the Watch List without Credit approval. This puts a burden on Credit to keep the Watch List up-to-date.

question: What was the incorrect counterparty name given for a deal involving Alain Diza, and what was the actual counterparty?
golden_answer: The incorrect counterparty name given was "Fulton County (NY) Board of Education," but the actual counterparty was "Fulton Housing Authority," an operator of low-income housing governed by the New York State Division of Housing.

question: What was the specific transaction for which Sutherland Asbill & Brennan sought conflicts clearance to represent Procter & Gamble?
golden_answer: The specific transaction was a put swaption for Northern Bleached Softwood Kraft that Procter & Gamble wished to enter with Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp.

question: What was the concern regarding Banco Nazionale del Lavora, and what action was taken?
golden_answer: The concern was the need for due diligence on Italian law, as the counterparty appeared to be incorporated in Italy. A proposed form of Enron Corp. Guaranty was faxed to the counterparty, but no trades were to be approved until the due diligence was completed.

question: What was Tana Jones's request regarding credit worksheets?
golden_answer: Tana Jones requested to be kept on the distribution for all credit worksheets to ensure she received copies of them.

question: What mechanism options were being considered for rationalizing load auction processes in the Governor's considerations?
golden_answer: They considered a reverse auction, competitive bidding for PLR, and a GCIM-like mechanism.

question: What were the top priorities and budget for the Rates/Regulatory group discussed in Colorado Springs?
golden_answer: The email mentions 'top 10 priorities and budget' but does not specify what they are.

question: How did SDG&E propose to change rate designs affecting voltage buy-up deals, and why was this protested?
golden_answer: SDG&E proposed to change rate design affecting voltage buy-up deals, which was protested due to concerns about scope, thoroughness of cost analysis, precedential effects, and interest in facilities-based services.

question: What topics were covered in Roger Yang's random thoughts on distribution pricing?
golden_answer: The email mentions 'random thoughts on distribution pricing including, rate design, standby rates, exit fees, pricing flexibility' but does not detail the thoughts.

question: What was the original contribution from the Northeast/Mid-Atlantic Region for the Colorado Springs meeting?
golden_answer: The contribution included an original budget and top 10 Y2K priorities.

question: What course is Kate Symes interested in taking and why is her registration delayed?
golden_answer: Kate Symes is interested in taking an online economics course offered by Professor Merryman. Her registration has been held up because her application for postbaccalaureate admission is delayed due to late transcripts.

question: What problem is Kate Symes researching related to the Settlements group?
golden_answer: Kate Symes is researching a problem where a Cal-PX index price didn't get posted, affecting a deal where EPMI sells to EES with the price based on the PX NP-15 index.

question: What was the subject of Kate Symes' email to Jon Alan Page?
golden_answer: The subject of the email was 'Sierra Pacific Resources', but the email body only states 'Let me know if this is what you wanted' without providing additional details.

question: How does Anna Mehrere suggest handling rebate checks at Enron?
golden_answer: Anna Mehrere suggests having rebate checks payable to Enron, sending them in on a Deposit Transmittal Form coded with the same codes used for the initial expense, or stapling the check to a piece of paper with the appropriate codes if the form is unavailable.

question: What does Kate Symes mention about Jessica's version in her email to Jim Buerkle?
golden_answer: Kate Symes mentions that Jessica's version of the cover page will probably work better than what she provided.

question: What mechanisms were being considered for rationalization in the email discussion between Paul Kaufman and Jeff Dasovich?
golden_answer: The mechanisms being considered for rationalization were a reverse auction, competitive bidding for PLR, and a GCIM-like mechanism.

question: What was the purpose of the mandatory 'Chinese Wall' training scheduled by Janette Elbertson?
golden_answer: The mandatory 'Chinese Wall' training was to ensure EWS could continue operating all its businesses, including equity trading, without violating securities laws.

question: What was the deadline for providing comments on the draft press release prepared by EEI announcing the joint effort with CUBR?
golden_answer: The deadline for providing comments on the draft press release was by close of business on September 29.

question: What is the URL provided in Mona Petrochko's email that contains details about PGE's press release and auction proposal?
golden_answer: The URL provided was http://www.pgecorp.com/news/releases/990930r.html.

question: Which commercial groups were highlighted for specific sessions in the 'Chinese Wall' training schedule?
golden_answer: The commercial groups highlighted were Resource Group, Origination/Business Development, Financial Trading Group, and Heads of Trading Desks.

question: What role did Enron formalize early in the year regarding trading operations, and why?
golden_answer: Enron formalized the role of Global Risk Management Operations to oversee controls in various Enron-wide offices regarding trading operations, due to the wholesale businesses' needs.

question: Who was the draft memo regarding Sally Beck's role in wholesale businesses operations intended for, and who was involved in its creation?
golden_answer: The draft memo was intended for Richard Causey and was co-authored with Mark Frevert to define Sally Beck's role in operations for the wholesale businesses.

question: What resource needs did Sally Beck offer to discuss in her weekly staff meeting based on Barry Pearce's requests?
golden_answer: Sally Beck offered to discuss resource needs for staffing Op Analyst group with quality accountants in her weekly staff meeting.

question: What topics did Sally Beck follow up on with Fernley Dyson regarding quarter-end and other updates?
golden_answer: Sally Beck followed up on Brent's role memo, Barry's impressions of Tokyo, Ted Murphy's conversation about Barry's potential role in Japan, attendance at the AA meeting in Chicago, and Todd Hall's work with James New.

question: What tasks did Sally Beck plan to complete on the afternoon of April 23, 2001, and why?
golden_answer: Sally Beck planned to complete the timeline and resource needs, rewrite the presentation to originators, recap commercialization efforts, work on her game plan for EES, and update Brian Redmond's meeting with Louise regarding HPL to share with Greg Piper.
